prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: A particular set of circumstances led to her being adopted by Mr. Wright. A world-class magician on the rise.
Character 1
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The youngest lawyer in our agency. She apparently studied psychology in Europe.
Character 2
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My boss. He's taught me a lot about what it means to be a lawyer.
Character 3
Name: Bonny → Bonny de Famme
Description: A bunny-themed assistant who appeared onstage with Trucy.
Character 4
Name: Mr. Retinz → Roger Retinz
Description: A man somehow connected to the magic show. He showed up at the theater after the incident took place.
Character 5
Name: The Great Mr. Reus
Description: The victim in this case. A magician who took the stage with Trucy.
Character 6
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective. It looks like she finally became the forensic investigator she always wanted to be.
Character 7
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A prosecutor from Khura'in. He's also a monk, which explains why he's known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 8
Name: Betty de Famme
Description: A magician who performed with Trucy. She is actually Bonny's twin sister.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.
Evidence 1
Name: Stage Diagram
Description: A diagram depicting the stage where the show was performed and the understage passage.
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Photo
Description: There are traces of blood in one of the coffin's holes. It's possible the blood was placed there after the fact.
Evidence 3
Name: Fingerprinting Results
Description: In addition to prints from the victim and Bonny, Betty de Famme's fingerprints were found on the top. There is no fingerprint evidence for Trucy Wright, however.
Evidence 4
Name: Fire Bucket
Description: A bucket to be used in case of fire. Not only was it empty, but dust lines the inside of the pail.
Evidence 5
Name: Gramarye Notebook
Description: The Troupe Gramarye creed, "A true entertainer always keeps a smile on their face," is written inside.
Evidence 6
Name: Thirteen-Year-Old Poster
Description: Mr. Reus was apparently ousted from Troupe Gramarye thirteen years ago due to an injury he sustained.
Evidence 7
Name: Show Script
Description: Bonny's script. The fire trick was canceled due to the incident. The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 8
Name: Contract
Description: A contract signed by Trucy herself. It details liability for compensation.
Evidence 9
Name: Trucy's Statement
Description: Trucy moved the stage lifts to cover for Bonny's mistake. She told no one about this.
Evidence 10
Name: Sword Stand
Description: Contains the rubber sword Trucy says she swapped in for the trick.
Evidence 11
Name: Stage Lift #2
Description: The stage lift Trucy had to move out of the way during the show since it was already all the way up.
Evidence 12
Name: Show Footage
Description: A disc with a recording of Trucy's escape trick on it.
Evidence 13
Name: Clipboard
Description: The clipboard used by Trucy to sign her contract. It was also instrumental in the Ratings Rajah's dishonest dealings.
Evidence 14
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The victim's real name was Manov Mistree. His blood is on the murder weapon.
Evidence 15
Name: Prank Plan Script
Description: The corpse appearing and the set piece falling were staged by Roger Retinz.
Evidence 16
Name: Trucy's Note
Description: A note found in the dressing room after the incident that bears Trucy's signature. [caption] The note reads: "Bonny, Get the video camera after Mr. Reus comes tumbling out." The signature is exactly the same beyond human capability as that on Trucy's contract.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: It's true. I had business in the understage passage because of the upcoming trick.
Person: Betty
Testimony 1
Testimony: It was the fire trick, right? The one Mr. Reus was supposed to do?
Person: Bonny
Testimony 2
Testimony: That's right. It's a very dangerous trick, so I had to make sure we were prepared for it.
Person: Betty
Testimony 3
Testimony: I-It was in the script... and I really wanted to see it... but I couldn't because of the accident.
Person: Bonny
Testimony 4
Testimony: Shut up! You're gonna give it away! ...Anyway, I was real busy.
Person: Betty
Testimony 5
Testimony: Yeah... Way too busy to have the chance to kill Mr. Reus...
Person: Bonny

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. First, I need to go through all the testimonies and the evidences to find any inconsistencies.

Looking at the testimonies, Betty and Bonny are the main ones here. Let's check each testimony one by one.

Testimony 0: Betty says she had business in the understage passage because of the upcoming trick. The evidence list includes a Stage Diagram (Evidence 1) which shows the understage passage. Maybe something here?

Testimony 1: Bonny mentions the fire trick that Mr. Reus was supposed to do. Evidence 7 is the Show Script which talks about the fire trick being canceled. But the script says they needed the fire bucket ready. Then there's Evidence 4, the Fire Bucket, which was empty and dusty. So if the script says to have the fire bucket ready, but the bucket was empty, maybe this contradicts Bonny's testimony that it was part of the script. Wait, Bonny's Testimony 1 is confirming the fire trick was in the script. But the Fire Bucket (Evidence 4) being empty and dusty suggests they weren't prepared, which the script (Evidence 7) said they should be. So maybe Bonny's Testimony 1 is contradicted by the Fire Bucket evidence? Or perhaps Betty's Testimony 2 where she says she had to make sure they were prepared for the fire trick, but the bucket wasn't ready. So if Betty was supposed to prepare the fire bucket, but it's empty, then her Testimony 2 is contradicted by Evidence 4.

Wait, Testimony 2 is Betty saying they had to be prepared for the fire trick. But Evidence 4 (Fire Bucket) is empty and dusty. So that's a contradiction. Because if they were prepared, the bucket should have been filled, not empty and dusty. So Evidence 4 contradicts Betty's Testimony 2.

Another possible contradiction: Testimony 5 is Bonny saying she was too busy to kill Mr. Reus. But Evidence 3 (Fingerprinting Results) has Betty's fingerprints on the top (of the coffin, maybe?), but no Trucy's. Not sure how that directly contradicts Bonny's testimony. Maybe another angle.

Looking at Testimony 3: Bonny says the fire trick was in the script but she couldn't see it because of the accident. The Show Script (Evidence 7) says the fire trick was canceled. So the script mentions preparing the bucket but the trick was canceled. Wait, the script's note says the fire trick was canceled due to the incident. But Bonny says she wanted to see it but couldn't because of the accident. But the script itself says the fire trick was canceled, so maybe the trick wasn't actually performed. So perhaps Bonny's Testimony 3 is conflicting with something. Wait, no, she says she wanted to see it but couldn't because of the accident. That might align if the accident caused the cancellation. Not sure. Maybe not a contradiction here.

Back to Betty's Testimony 2: She says she had to make sure they were prepared for the fire trick. But the Fire Bucket (Evidence 4) being empty and dusty suggests they weren't prepared. So that's a direct contradiction. Therefore, Evidence 4 contradicts Testimony 2 (Betty's).

Another possible contradiction: Evidence 16 is Trucy's Note, which has a signature identical to her contract. The note tells Bonny to get the video camera after Mr. Reus comes out. But if Trucy didn't write it (since the signature is too perfect, implying forgery), then maybe someone else wrote it. But how does this contradict a testimony? Let's check testimonies again. Bonny's Testimony 5 says she was too busy to kill, but if the note was forged, maybe someone else (like Retinz) set up the prank. But that might link to Testimony 5, but not directly.

Alternatively, Evidence 3 (Fingerprinting Results) shows Betty's fingerprints on the top (maybe the coffin), but Trucy's aren't there. If Betty was supposed to be busy elsewhere, but her fingerprints are present, that could contradict her Testimony 4 where she says she was real busy. But Testimony 4 is Betty's statement that she was busy. If her fingerprints are on the coffin, perhaps she had time to touch it, contradicting her claim of being too busy. However, Testimony 5 is Bonny saying she was too busy. Wait, Testimony 5 is Bonny's, so maybe Evidence 3 (Betty's fingerprints) contradicts Betty's own testimony. Let me check.

Testimony 4: Betty says "Shut up! You're gonna give it away! ...Anyway, I was real busy." Then Testimony 5: Bonny says "Yeah... Way too busy to have the chance to kill Mr. Reus..." So both Betty and Bonny are claiming they were busy. But Evidence 3 shows Betty's fingerprints on the top (of the murder weapon?), which might imply she had contact with it, contradicting her being too busy. But the exact connection isn't clear. However, the more direct contradiction is between Betty's Testimony 2 and Evidence 4 (Fire Bucket empty). Because Testimony 2 says Betty made sure they were prepared for the dangerous fire trick, but the Fire Bucket was empty and dusty, meaning they weren't prepared. That's a clear contradiction. Therefore, Evidence 4 (Fire Bucket) contradicts Testimony 2 (Betty's).

{"evidence": 4, "testimony": 2}
